content.raw:
I've run with this branch applied on top of default for about an hour, mostly working on task2.

It seems to work fine.  The feet seem shaky after a re-harness; I find it important to square them, and the controller seems to like to dip low at least once in the first few steps, but it broadly seems to work.

Sure is nice not to have to restart when I accidentally walk into the trailer... :-)
content.html:
I've run with this branch applied on top of default for about an hour, mostly working on task2.

It seems to work fine. The feet seem shaky after a re-harness; I find it important to square them, and the controller seems to like to dip low at least once in the first few steps, but it broadly seems to work.

Sure is nice not to have to restart when I accidentally walk into the trailer... :-)
